original: In economic theory, a weakening of the graph-continuity assumption is observed in the properties of utility functions. Specifically, each utility function \( U_i \) is characterized by quasi-concavity in \( x_i \), upper semi-continuity in \( x \), and the function \( W_i(x_{-i}) := \max_{x_i} U_i(x_i, x_{-i}) \) is lower semi-
